website_summaries.verdict: Top-notch technology with a few "bugs" – choose if you want a mini smart plug and don't mind the higher price.
pros: Features a streamlined design that doesn't take up 2 outlets
Free app is easy to set up and customer support is attentive
cons: Higher price – only get one for the price
Issues with the app crashing have been reported
Not as energy efficient as some competitors

customer_reviews.title: The app makes this a huge pain
customer_reviews.text: The app that accompanies this product is simply garbage. The design and usability are abysmal. It is horribly organized, lags TERRIBLY and is horribly unintuitive. It seriously feels like an initial beta offering, not a finished product. It's sufficiently bad that I'm returning this plug and am going to try a competitors product. To be clear, I have a brand new flagship phone, a beastly mesh wifi network and am not a tech novice. It took me only ten minutes to become irritated trying to use this product because the app is so bad.
customer_reviews.author: Mars Allred

customer_reviews.title: There should be a class action suit for a refund and damages
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing to like about this device. I don't know if the good reviews are fake or it's just that half of these work and half of them don't so it's the luck of the draw whether you get one that works or not. I got one that just doesn't work. It took several times before the set up finally took hold only for it not to function. It's like buying something on Kickstarter being pitched by people with no ability to deliver a working gadget.
customer_reviews.author: New York Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects from network (and does not reconnect) between uses.
customer_reviews.text: These were worthless for us. Although it worked for a short time after a painless setup, it quickly loses connection to the network. You can unplug it and plug it back in to reconnect it, but we had to do so EVERY time we wanted to turn on the device. Kinda defeats the purpose. When connected to the network, the Wemo app and Google Assistant were able to control the device fine. It appears to be compatible, but not stable.
customer_reviews.author: David P May

customer_reviews.title: I literally just threw mine in the trash
customer_reviews.text: I had this plug for about six months to turn on a lamp I use frequently. It had such a weak wifi signal that I got used to refreshing the app over and over again to turn the device on or off. Tonight I finally got tired of this and Reset it to factory settings. Unfortunately however mine didn’t have a setup code printed on the back or a we code (it was only in the box that’s now long gone). So there was no way to reset it. Total waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Choose carefully
customer_reviews.text: These are great in theory. Worked out of the box fine. Then remote access stopped working for no apparent reason. Then the app lost all my devices. Took several hours to reset and register and reconfigure to get back to where it should have been. Unacceptable for us and when it happens again we will switch away from wemo completely.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Make sure your network password has only letters and numbers
customer_reviews.text: These work great IF your network meets its requirements. We changed internet providers and the new provider supplies a Wifi router+modem which requires a special character in the password. Suddenly our Wemo plugs do not work. After multiple fruitless email and chat sessions, I discover that the Wemo requires that the WiFi password cannot contain special characters-only letters and numbers. This would be a simple firmware fix.
customer_reviews.author: P. Craig

customer_reviews.title: Can't Connect
customer_reviews.text: Glad I purchased this packaged with an echo as it was only a 5 bunk add-on. Most of my home home is using Luton devices and I highly recommend them but I will stay away from these. I have both a SmartThings and Lutron Hub connected to control TV's, dimmers, lighting switches and thermostats in my home which are also controllable through Alexa. I have spent a couple hours now on the various forums including the manufacturer and I probably just have a bad unit, but I also ran into issues while installing a Belkin wireless dimmer for my neighbor. Personally I would stay away from Belkin home automation products.
customer_reviews.author: D. Miller

customer_reviews.title: App to setup plugs no longer works
customer_reviews.text: I have had 7 Wemo smart plugs working just fine for a couple of years. I upgraded my router and had great difficulty changing their setup to the new router. I have not been able to get two of them working again. Purchased a new one and can not get it setup. The phone App has been changed at some point in time since my initial setup and no longer works. If you want a smart plug look at the other brands.
customer_reviews.author: LAH

customer_reviews.title: Works great with apple HomeKit
customer_reviews.text: The Wemo app is great for setting everything up, scheduling timers, and accessing devices when away from home. The devices also sync with Apple HomeKit, giving me quick control over my devices using Siri or the swipe up menu on my iPhone (an icon shows up right by the flashlight button). HomeKit allows me to group devices together, so I can just tell Siri “Christmas on“ and the three plugs controlling my tree and Christmas lights all turn on. But without an Apple TV or HomePod, the HomeKit app will not let me do any automation. Overall, weMo seems too lack advanced functionality, but does the basics very well.
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: These just don't work properly with Homekit, period. They were advertised as such, and no matter what I do, one or both of them are offline constantly. To be clear, I am speaking specifically to HOMEKIT INTEGRATION. The Wemo app works flawlessly every time I open it. But I am not trying to use 5 different apps to control everything. If it says "works with Homekit", that is my expectation EVERY TIME I USE IT. This is why people are hesitant about smart homes. These things just aren't what they're cracked up to be, they don't talk to each other. Too late to return or I would. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: Utter Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Refuses to use WiFi password. Confirmed multiple times the correct one, and it simply won't connect. Of the 20 or so other automation items I have in my setup, this is my only WeMo/Belkin device. None of the others have had this issue. WeMo and Belkin are now permanently excluded from the list of manufacturers acceptable in my home or my business. I wasted far more of my time than this item is worth trying to get it to configure properly. Never again. Belkin used to be quality, and now it's utter garbage.
customer_reviews.author: GojiraST

customer_reviews.title: Before you buy, please read.
customer_reviews.text: I have over 15 wemo products over 3 years. I cannot recommend these with good conscious. Please see the most RECENT app reviews for this product. Save yourself time and money. Stay away from Wemo. The hardware looks great. Their software feels like it was written by elementary kids and their servers are run by kindergartners unplugging and replugging the server cables constantly. Not joking. When buying a smart home device, always check their app reviews. Don't make the same mistake that I have made.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: There are better choices than Wemo products
customer_reviews.text: When it works it’s great. Problem is that in the year and half I’ve owned it the product rarely works. I have 600 mb/s connection with top of the line router and modem ($600) and it still does not connect 95% of the time. It’s been the same through two different routers and modems. It may go a few day stretch connected when first installed but that’s it. I’ve cleared everything and started fresh and still have issues. Positive reviews must be from initial instruction as I purchased and installed 7 various units and have over a year of troubleshooting and using wemo products. Junk.
customer_reviews.author: Kujo

customer_reviews.title: An Infinity Loop of Problems!  👎👎
customer_reviews.text: Wemo is a HORRIBLE infinity loop of problems. Set up for Apple HomeKit is horrible and I cannot get it to work despite being on my second mini and three calls to the aweful tech support! I’m sending this horrible thing back for a second time and choosing another brand. I also found Wemo to be a security risk on my network and it requires a lot of you personal data from you. Save yourself the time, life force, and energy that this little vampire will suck from you by AVOIDING THIS THING LIKE THE PLAGUE!
customer_reviews.author: R. G.

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable—The Plugs Randomly Lose WiFi Connection and Become Unresponsive
customer_reviews.text: We installed 8 Of these WeMo plugs because they don’t require a hub. We thought the Belkin brand would assure high quality and good connectivity. Wrong! Our mesh router has a strong Wi-Fi signal throughout the house, but these switches are just flaky. Individual plugs randomly disappear from (and later unpredictably reappear on) the local network. While they are off network, they usually execute scheduled changes but won’t respond to Alexa until they happen to pop back onto the network. We replaced all 8 WeMo plugs with The similar—and $5 cheaper—Amazon smart plugs. The Amazon plugs respond much faster and have so far been reliable.
customer_reviews.author: DiscerningConsumer94010

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Useless with Echo, Don’t Waste Your Money.
customer_reviews.text: Completely useless waste of money. Have continuously updated, reset and reset again. Zero support. On hold over 30 minutes, TWICE. Their app won’t even send in a problem report that generates when the useless plug won’t work. The app is a complete disaster, doesn’t work 75% of the time. Please do not waste your time and money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Daulong

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't really work with Homekit
customer_reviews.text: I guess 'works with homekit' means something different to me. For me, this means that somewhere in the box is a QR Code that I can scan with my home app and have the device set up in seconds without having to download another app. With this plug, I had to download the app, change my wifi on my phone to connect to the plug, and then on step 3 (give them my email so they can send me 'important info'), I gave up. There are plenty of smart plugs for the same price or less where setup is a matter of seconds and doesn't require yet another app. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Perry Kibler

customer_reviews.title: Setup refuses to connect until after multiple attempts. Firmware killed my new setup.
customer_reviews.text: I finally got this thing initialized after spending hour trying to get it to connect. I did nothing different, only just kept trying until at a whim it decided to connect on its own. Proximity wasn't the issue On 2.4ghz wifi. Then I tried a firmware update, which killed the device. Wirecutter doesn't even acknowledge all the comments and experiences in their article staring that this is not "best" smart plug in the market. The author quips back to commenters she doesn't experience any problems, standing her ground instead of getting a general consensus.I also own a few other brands which require less time and effort and struggle. Wemo, fix your product.
customer_reviews.author: J L

customer_reviews.title: Does not work remotely
customer_reviews.text: The product does not work remotely as it is stated. The firmware updates also do not work. If I am home I can get the devices to work from my iphone and once set up the "rules" for time of day, etc. work but you have to turn them on while at home as you cannot connect remotely. I have had much better luck with KASA products. Only keeping these as I sunk too much money into to throw away without getting some use out of them.
customer_reviews.author: sdtreviewer

customer_reviews.title: Unable to connect to WiFi
customer_reviews.text: After my 7th or 8th attempt I was able to get the plug to accept the settings and let me go past the setup screen, including enabling Remote Access. However, it immediately lost connection and never came back. I moved it closer to the router, 10ft, and nothing. Awful product. I have other smart home devices such as Alexa, Sonos, a Wyze camera, never had this much trouble, they were all set up in one try Even though the plug says it's not connected, and my Android phone's app says it's not visible,I go into my router and it shows that the plug IS connected. Thanks to Amazon for their very generous return policy.
customer_reviews.author: G. SALLES

customer_reviews.title: Piece of garbage
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these to control lighting fixtures. They worked well for about a month. I was able to connect them to my google assistant, was able to detect them easily on the app and make had IFFTT integration. Then, suddenly both stopped working. Could not set them backup with google assistant, are not recognized by the wemo app. I emailed customer service. They told me they were working on the problem. This was back in April 2019. It is now September and they haven't worked it out yet. Do not spend your money on these. The product is garbage and so is the engineering team at wemo.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: melted itself and my coffeepot
customer_reviews.text: I had no issues getting this plug to recognize my network or getting it set up. However after using for a few months, I found that it had melted the plastic of the smart plug and melted the cord around the prongs of my coffeepot as well. Have had this coffeepot for a while and used with multiple outlets (both wall and smart) and never had any issues. I used the timer function so the coffeepot was on for 30 minutes each morning. Wall outlet is newer. Clearly manufacture defect as others have said. Returning/replacing is a real pain. Won't buy this again. Luckily it did not start a fire. Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: R. Pierson

customer_reviews.title: Hacker friendly & Horrible setup
customer_reviews.text: The product must have a firmware update issue. Installation was 3x more difficult than prior installs of the same device, and it took multiple resets to allow the devices to synchronize with HomeKit. Further, the devices broadcast an insecure WiFi signal even after setup to the whole neighborhood; since the device holds all the network password information this makes the whole home network susceptible to hacking. I returned the product and replaced in hopes a replacement Wemo device will be bug-free.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Time
customer_reviews.text: This thing constantly disconnects from my wifi which causes me to have to reset it. Then it doesn't recognize my password - which has not changed- so I have to factory reset it. But wait, in order to set it up again I need a code from the paperwork that came with it a year ago. This is ridiculous! It's a plug for goodness sake! We should be able to set it up without a code!
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Broken by an "Upgrade"
customer_reviews.text: This was a great product. It turned things on and off when I scheduled then and got it right most of the time. 5 stars. After 18 months of good behavior, WeMo was broken by a firmware upgrade. The upgrade required that I set passwords for my devices. Not a bad idea. But, these losers implemented it in such a way that it takes MINUTES to log into my devices. No, it's not a complex process, it takes many MINUTES to get a prompt in the first place. Save yourself some grief and but another product!
customer_reviews.author: Elderbear

customer_reviews.title: Smaller Footprint for Access to all of Your Wall Outlets
customer_reviews.text: The Wemo Mini Smart Plug is the new and improved version of its big brother predecessor the Wemo Switch smart plug. It is basically the same device with a smaller footprint and more pleasing form factor. Watch the video review from our YouTube channel -Smart Home Tech- to get a more in depth perspective of the device.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Home TechTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: It started out great, then became unresponsive after a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at first, but stopped working right. Both my Google mini and Alexa are always telling me Wemo is not available. Strangely enough, after a 10-15 minute delay, the lamp randomly turns on. Really disappointed with these. The non name brand ones I purchased seem to be bullet proof compared to these. Wish I could return them.
customer_reviews.author: amazonjunkie

customer_reviews.title: A handy and fun little device.
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered another one. I use this on an old lamp that is hard to turn off and on using a pull chain. I had a little trouble with the WiFi signal at first. I used Alexa voice command to turn on/off the lamp instead. All problems were resolved when I updated the device software. I also use the timer so my lamp comes on just before I get up. If I get up early I manually turn it on with my iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: N. Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable performance
customer_reviews.text: Unreliable. These have failed numerous times in the past 6 months which require factory reset and reconnecting to my wifi. The process is painfully slow, approximately 1 hr for 2 Wemos. The HomeKit sticker is also on the back side of the plug rendering the code useless, so you have to keep your documentation from the box in order to get your codes. I have many Belkin devices over the years so I am disappointed in these.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Ondriezek

customer_reviews.title: i am lazy
customer_reviews.text: Instead of getting an expensive coffee pot with a timer, or a Wemo enabled coffee pot, I bought one of these and a $15 Mr. Coffee pot, set it to my Alexa morning routine, and it works great. You need to use a coffee pot that has a toggle switch so it's always "on" and no matter how often I ask, Alexa will still not load the water or grind the beans. Or throw away the filters or clean the machine. Wow, making coffee is a lot of work, it's tiring me out just thinking about it. I think I need a cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: bowiezinspace

customer_reviews.title: nice features, poor wifi reception.
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instruction carefully and my galaxy s9+ had the option to ignore mobile connection during the setup process, so that' s why this got 3 star rating. It lost 2 start because the wifi antenna reception is bad, I have the amazon smart plug that I must have paid $5 picks up wifi better, in the same plug outlet wemo was in, not just in 1 but 2 different locations. I finally found a spot with good enough wifi for it to work. I did the setup in a location that had great wifi but didn't need to use it there, maybe that's why my setup was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Pierre J. Nakashian

customer_reviews.title: 2 1/2 years later... no, just no
customer_reviews.text: I love them when the DO work, but didn't love the confusing set up (HORRIBLE/IMPOSSIBLE if you move), from the start they were unreliable and only became worse as the years passed. Two and half years later only one of the eight I purchased are still working. I won't be buying these again. I have had better luck buying Philips Hue for lights and just buying smart devices for everything else. And on't EVEN get me started on the Alexa App Routines. Do these EVER work???
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Horrible SW and does not pair easily
customer_reviews.text: SW is horrible, and possible hardware too. Cannot connect very easily, eventually it does but loses connection overnight then you will have to pair again to your Wifi AP. Absolute junk, don't waste your money. Just wondering what these engineers were thinking when they decide to pair the device in such a way. At the minimum, have a real hard reset button. In addition, the QR code is on the plug side of the device, while pairing, you need the QR code on the app, but you can't unplug the device, LOL, serious stupidity. All this time, I hope they would roll out new FW to upgrade the unit, but there's never new FW to update.
customer_reviews.author: DN

customer_reviews.title: Hardware works great, the app and firmware updates suck.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a year ago, and up until the latest firmware update have had no issues. But now with the latest firmware update on the Wemo app it has rendered this device completely useless. The app no longer connects to the device no matter how many times I try to reset and reconnect the device using the manufacturer's instructions on their site. I am beginning to feel like Belkin is forcing me to upgrade, due to their software updates seemingly making this product redundant. Again, worked great with Alexa/Google for about a year but the most recent iOs Wemo App update completely wrecked this device.
customer_reviews.author: ck

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but there are easier devices to setup
customer_reviews.text: These are nice plugs for the money and work as expected I had a few issues getting them setup multiple time. I had bought 4 of these in total. Each one had issues conned ting to the wireless in two different houses and was pretty frustrating to get setup up. None of them connected easily or the first time. Once they were connected I didnt really have any issues. Pros - works as intended once setup - nice to be able to schedule and manually controlled the outlets Cons - annoying and difficult to setup with the wifi, none setup properly the first time on two different networks.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works with Google assistant
customer_reviews.text: I set this up in conjunction with my grow lights. There is a dusk / dawn rule which is super useful. I can check if they're on or off in the WeMo AND Google Home app. I purchased one about a year ago, and a second one last week. The ONLY issue I've ever had was very simple to resolve once I figured it out. It kept refusing to connect to the WeMo Smart Plug on initial setup because it was an unsecured network. I disconnected from my home wifi and connected to the WeMo directly. After, I then connected back to my home network and ran a firmware update. This protects your network security! You should definitely do it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking - Wemo no longer functional
customer_reviews.text: I have used a number of Wemo devices for years. While they have admittedly always been a hassle to set-up and are frequently unstable, recent updates have completely eliminated all functionality. After following every troubleshooting step repeatedly, uninstalling, rebooting, reconnecting, resetting and seeking online support, realize these are devices are essentially worthless as I am unable to add any of my existing devices to the iOS app. Online searches reveal this is a common frustration and experience for many users which Wemo appears to have little interest in addressing.
customer_reviews.author: JR 202

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working with Amazon Alexa!
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these and they worked for a year, then they stopped working with Alexa. I get the “Cannot communicate with provider” message every time I ask Alexa to turn it on. The film ware is up to date and I have tried all troubleshooting steps of uninstalling and reinstalling apps for Amazon and Wemo still nothing. Very disappointed. I have two Amazon Alexa plugs that I bought around the same time and they still work flawlessly. My advice would be to buy the Amazon plugs if you want it to work with Alexa!
customer_reviews.author: Jill V.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my projects
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Love it! Love It! I bought one for an automated dog door opener project and it works flawlessly. I would think that there would be a delay between the app and the switch turning on but I was wrong, the switch works instantly. I was impressed enough to buy a couple more for my other projects. I have not figured out how to rename a switch after you set it up, but I have not researched into it yet. I guess just make sure about the name when you set it up.
customer_reviews.author: justin hedricks

customer_reviews.title: Not as bad as I thought
customer_reviews.text: Was a little concerned purchasing this product due to the many reviews of poor connection when trying to setup. Upon my initial setup I received a network error notification through the Wemo app. I opened apple HomeKit, scanned the QR code on the back of the plug and it connected it seamlessly. I did have to do an update on it but that’s expected. Now all I have to do is tell Siri to turn my heater on/off and I’ll never walk into a cold office again :). So far it works great. Will also be setting one up at home with Amazon Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: eileen schwab

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a Year, that's all you get
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work. It worked for a year or so then apparently they updated their app with something seriously buggy and useless and broken and now after having changed out my WiFi router it just doesn't work at all, it won't connect and whenever I get it to connect for a second it quits connecting and fails saying device not detected. It's a useless turd of a device, don't buy this, buy something, anything else. Update: Got it working but it always loses connection and I have to start the whole annoying process of troubleshooting and getting it connected with the app all over again whenever I reset my router or anything whatsoever disturbs the force.
customer_reviews.author: Sephethus

customer_reviews.title: Need a lot of work
customer_reviews.text: This review is my experience with this device and HomeKit from Apple, I own HomeKit devices, and they all work with no problem, but the Wemo “smart” plug is far a way for being smart. It took me more than an hour just to connect it to the Wemo app then took longer to connect to my WiFi. Once everything was working for about an hour or so, lost connection for no reason. Closing the app and opening it will make it work for a bit and it will disconnect again. It did this over and over for a couple of days. It’s just a horrible experience. I would not recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: These work really well and are great for the price. A few notes worth mentioning: When you first set them up they emit their own wifi network for your device to connect to, so when setting it up you should be near the device itself rather than just on your network. Also, as others have mentioned, if you have a 5G wifi network on your router you will need to make sure that you set this up on the *non* 5G wifi network. It apparently does not work on the 5G network. So, I found this info from another reviewer and it made my installation a breeze. The devices work great and the schedule feature is very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Initials

customer_reviews.title: Wemo mini smart plug, not great with alexa
customer_reviews.text: Worked correctly for 2 days then Alexa said it isn't responding, works fine on wemo app. Issue seems be with Alexa communication. . Re enabled skill, reinstalled wemo app. No luck. Research suggests some reinstalled all smart home devices. I'm not doing that, number of others note it randomly disconnects. I'm returning it. Have two others kasa and tplink work great year or more. Waste of time and money. Added: woke up next morning, thought for a joke I'd ask Alexa to turn on aforementioned light. Guess what, it works again. Same things that wouldn't work last night. Now fine. What gives? Too weird.
customer_reviews.author: P. Mendelberg

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time!
customer_reviews.text: This is THE MOST illogical and stupidly put together configuration for a smart device. Why on earth would you have the user plug in the device, which is necessary for set up, and then as part of the set up require that the code on the back of the device be scanned in order to function?!?! The code is kissing the damn wall!!!! How in hell am I to set up the device???! There’s also a crappy receptive connection for these devices. They simply do not work. I’m returning these today! Waste of time!!
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Does not work in a second home with the same app!
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed. I have another wemo switch at my house but tried to install another at a second home. It completely does not work. I called tech support and after half an hour on hold they said you have to get another phone with another installation of their app in order to manage the device on the second home network. How dumb is that? Will return. I have since looked online and they've been aware of this issue for at least 3 years. It seems they don't care about the large market of people with a second home who might want to manage devices remotely.
customer_reviews.author: melix

customer_reviews.title: Works Intermittently at Best
customer_reviews.text: Works great when it works. Timer works great, easy setup. BUT. Any disruption to Wi-Fi results in disconnection, blinking orange or blinking orange-white indicators, and ‘do not recognize’ app (wemo and home) status (and no functionality. Impossible to reconnect - no wemo instructions for blinking orange, follow white-orange instructions, doesn’t work. Perform complete reset, doesn’t work. And doesn’t sync with any other system (eg, Control4). Frankly, for a simple ‘dumb’ light switch (that is all this is) an expensive royal pain in the xxx.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: NOT COMPATIBLE WITH YOUR ALEXA APP!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 WeMo Mini plugs in a pack from national box store. They work with the phone app but Alexa cant find them so they are useless packed with any Alexa Device. I tried reseting Wemo and uninstalling both apps. Confirming all devices on the same network 2.4 ghz yada yada. These are useless in verbal commands or routines since Alexa will probably not let you add them. BTW I already had one purchased from Amazon after buying an Echo Dot which worked very well with Alexa app...until I tried setting up the new 2 pack and now the original doesnt work with Alexa either!
customer_reviews.author: Bud E

customer_reviews.title: app has become worthless and changing network made more worthless
customer_reviews.text: they were great till I switched my router. the old ones could not reconnect, so got new ones, after hour of trying finally got one to connect only for it to not be visible in the app. tried uninstall of app, can't remove from app, uninstall and reinstall no go. tried factory reset, no go, tried troubleshooting no luck.
customer_reviews.author: JudoNinja

customer_reviews.title: BUGGY
customer_reviews.text: This is a super buggy smart plug. It worked at first via the bridge with HomeKit and then they changed it so you didn’t need the bridge but they didn’t give you a HomeKit code with the original plug so that’s useless. It’s endless frustrating and buggy. Not to mention the bridge is impossible to get to connect to HomeKit
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 364 days exactly
customer_reviews.text: This was great while it lasted. I used the timer function so my pets would have lights in the evening even if i wasnit home yet. i loved that i could tell alexa to turn lights out at night l. sadly it stopped working the past few weeks a little at a time, it stopped showing up in the app and a few weeks later alexa didnt recognize it and now it wont do anything and cant be reset. To be honest if I did my research and realized it was made by Belkin i never would have purchased it. This type of thing has happened to me with their products in the past. It worked while while it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Candy

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly hard to get connected
customer_reviews.text: My personal experience (I own 4 of them) is that they are incredibly difficult to get connected to WiFi. I have a tri-band router with one 2.4GHz band and two separate 5GHz bands. The only way I have found to work with iOS is to temporarily disable my upper band radios, do a hard reset of the Wemo, complete the setup, then turn the radios back on. There's something broken in the app where it doesn't want to let you copy and paste the wifi password, I don't know why. I've wasted hours on these things. Otherwise, once setup, these seem work like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Works well when it works...but doesn't always work.
customer_reviews.text: For most part, it works well if you're intention is to program it once and never touch it again. However, my issue with this product is that when I need to reprogram the "rules", the Wemo app is unable to detect the device. This is very frustrating. I have 4 other Wemo smart plugs and they are all hit-or-miss when it comes to detection [in the app]. I tried the app on both iOS and Android. One advice from Wemo is to unplug it for 20 seconds then plug it back in. I've tried that and that method is also hit-or-miss. If I had to do it all over again, I would have purchased another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Yoojin Kim

customer_reviews.title: Would be five star if more consistency
customer_reviews.text: These were awesome when we hooked them up to our indoor Christmas lights and we could just say “Hey google, turn on the living room.” We hooked up our regular living room lights to them after Christmas and we were excited to lose some unsightly extension cords. However, the connection has not been consistent at all, which has been disappointing. Many times I have had to go to the app instead of being able to run through Google. Granted, all of this is still easier than standing on furniture and reaching the switches on the lights.
customer_reviews.author: Music Mom

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent connectivity
customer_reviews.text: I have a very robust WiFi environment, with the WeMo in close proximiity to the wireless router. This plug can't seem to stay connected. I am not a professional IT guy. I do not have the time to mess with this for hours on end. This device is supposed to make my life easier, not require repeated factory resets and re-installs. Get with the program WeMo! There are a lot of smart plugs coming out and I am sure Belkin doesn't want to lose market share!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Other companies make better smart plugs
customer_reviews.text: The description of this device looks great, and I thought Belkin makes decent stuff, but it performs horribly. (I had 3, and all exhibit the same poor characteristics.) The first time setup is not difficult, but good luck if you afterwards lose power, lose your WiFi, or move the device. And the scheduling menu is not as intuitive as it should be. The 2nd time setup is so inconvenient, I’m throwing in the towel and replacing the devices with a well-rated competitor’s model. Had high hopes, but this is just a poor piece of hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Williams

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy Belkin Wemo, their products and app are infuriating garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely useless and infuriating. I bought a Wemo mini "smart" plug to replace an older Wemo unit that kept losing its wifi connection. The new unit kept getting dropped from the app. So, I called Wemo tech support who walked me thru a reset. The device worked again... for a day. Then the app said it couldn't connect, again. How a company can stay in business with such a shit product is beyond me. My GE smart plugs give me no reliability issues and work as advertised. If you're on the fence about spending money for Wemo products, consider the number of bad reviews they get. Just trying to help you save your hard-earned money.
customer_reviews.author: Will Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Automation does not work. Bad software
customer_reviews.text: Around a year ago these seemed to work okay. There was a fair amount of lag time connecting and executing but they worked. I have three if these in my home. The schedule and time functions no longer function. They intermittently communicate with the app. Also the app is constantly trying to update firmware with no luck. It will be a spinning wheel for days, or go to a blank page in the app. If you simply want a "smart" plug that turns things in and off manually these serve that function okay. If you want to schedule automation good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Professor Ty Sanders, Esq.

customer_reviews.title: Junk device will not finish set up, not worth considering.
customer_reviews.text: Junk will not complete set up process regardless of device used for set up. Samsung S5, Fire Tablet and the Echo Show all failed with this semi product. Support very limited and problem is unresolved after calling. Resetting plug failed, resetting router and removing/reinstalling software failed to fix the problem of plug not finishing setup. Not very easy to setup given the limited process. Trouble shooting is a joke and support couldn't fix problem. Two defective plugs not worth the effort, since it will not work.
customer_reviews.author: rt66west

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: Just returned after spending nearly an hour trying to get this to work. Even resent router, a big waste of time. This simply doesn't work for many buyers. Had planned to use while on a trip to keep a light on. Now will have to travel without the device because it's crap. Do Not Buy!
customer_reviews.author: Pathfinder

customer_reviews.title: Painful to connect to WIFI, had to return
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these plugs and spent so much time trying to get them to connect to WIFI, without any success. Not content to use them as expensive push-button plugs, I returned them both and got Kasa plugs instead. I was able to setup two Kasa plugs in no time. Wemo seriously need to work on this WIFI connectivity issue. It's simply not usable. I don't see why it gets 4 star ratings here.
customer_reviews.author: StarDust

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: This WeMo mini worked for about one week. After that I had to reset it every day to get it to work. It would always say “not detected”. my Wi-Fi was only across the room so it’s not like it was out of range. I then found out I could hook it up through my Echo Dot with Alexa. That worked for two or three days and then the same issues started again. After many phone calls and emails, the company,Belkin, will issue me a refund!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable connection; requires router to forward multicast/broadcast traffic; security risk
customer_reviews.text: Bought two; wish I hadn't. First, in order to use these with Alexa your wifi router must forward broadcast and multicast traffic, which adds congestion to your wifi network. Second, these actually have two radios (two MAC addresses), one of which represents a security risk and needs to be turned off (don't allow traffic from the Internet, i.e., don't use your phone to operate these). Third, unless you have a very short, unobstructed path between the device and your wifi router, don't even bother.
customer_reviews.author: Roger1

customer_reviews.title: This Was Great, Then Belkin Updated Something
customer_reviews.text: When I first purchased this smart plug, it was flawless. Fast setup, worked exactly as it was supposed to even in an area of my home where the wi-fi signal was just ok. A couple of months ago, Belkin apparently pushed both a firmware update (that failed) and an app update that broke almost everything. Now my plug won't respond to anything despite doing multiple factory resets and trying with both Android and iPadOS devices. It's useless to me now.
customer_reviews.author: LWaloski

customer_reviews.title: Great Household Automation!
customer_reviews.text: I love these Wemo Mini Smart plugs. I have 7 of them now and use them to control lights in various rooms as well as night lights in hallways and the kitchen. They've always worked well and only occasionally have glitches during initial setup or firmware updates. They are virtually trouble free ways to bring smart IOT technology into the home at minimal cost. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: RHK

customer_reviews.title: I heard so many good things about this unit and I was very disappointed ...
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was as promised. Product well packaged. Instructions were clear. However, it would not accept my wi-fi password to connect. I tried several trouble shooting tips. Different outlets, security on wi-fi WPA/WPA2. No luck. Requested return auth and was given the choice of accepting a 2nd unit and replacing the 1st. I agreed. 2nd Wemo had same problem. Wi-fi password was rejected. So I felt I had no choice but to return. I heard so many good things about this unit and I was very disappointed that it would not connect. I order competing brand and had no trouble at all connecting. I wish others better luck. RL
customer_reviews.author: Lamplighter

customer_reviews.title: c
customer_reviews.text: Literally an on/off switch. Meaning I plugged a Dyson fan into this, I can turn it off - but not on. Sure when you activate this device you get power to your fan, but you still have to use the remote. In other words, if you're a smart home enthusiast who wants to create a routine, perhaps start your fan at bedtime - you can't. If you are however someone who often forgets to turn your devices off, this might be for you. Literally just an on/off sitch.
customer_reviews.author: Devin Michaud

customer_reviews.title: Warning: not possible to connect Wemo mini smart plugs to eero and/or some VPNs
customer_reviews.text: If you have an eero wire mesh network or any kind of VPN, I would advise trying smart plugs other than Wemo. I've spent hours trying to connect to my home network, spent > 2 hours on the phone with two Wemo techs--no luck. The supervising tech finally admitted these do not always work with wire mesh systems or VPNs. I wish I could return the 3 plugs I purchased through Amazon, but I'm past the 30 day return period and wemo will not refund, only provide replacements. I ended up buying Potemics and they installed on my eero system and VPN in ~ 20 min. Lesson learned!
customer_reviews.author: MLS1492

customer_reviews.title: Terrible  smart plug
customer_reviews.text: This Wemo is terrible. It does not detect my home wifi . I have numerous other wireless devices with out any problem connecting to the wifi. I reset the device many times. Tired of putting my email address every time I start setup. What a stupid software design ( I assume that these guys think that their hardware works all the time). Why do I have to restart my router when all the other devices have no problem connecting to the wifi. Why can't these guys fix their problem instead of telling other people to reset the router.
customer_reviews.author: abejo

customer_reviews.title: I've used these for years and they've always been a pain.
customer_reviews.text: It's time for me to switch to a different brand. These things have ALWAYS been a total pain to set up, the app is absolute garbage, and half the time Google will say that it can't find them. I just moved, and the switches CANNOT be set up on my new network. The app just refuses to connect, saying "Whoops, our cloud service is down!" The iHome smart plugs my roommate had would connect within seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle W.

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy, total garbage
customer_reviews.text: Right now there's an outage where it won't connect to google home. If you reach out for help on Twitter, they'll just tell you to do all these nonsense steps like replug in the devices, restart your phone, etc. A lot of people are experiencing this, but they'll make you go through all these steps rather than admit there's a problem and techs are working on it. Wemo is a terrible company I regret doing business with them. Buy any other smart devices. AVOID WEMO!
customer_reviews.author: Edwin

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to install
customer_reviews.text: I spent an hour trying to connect to my WiFi with no luck with 2 different devices with the same result (can't find my network). Just do a search for problems connecting to your WiFi and see all the people who have had the same problem. I have tried all the tricks, resets and reboots with the exception of re-configuring my router as that would require resetting all the other devices connected to my WiFi. Pretty packaging, nice directions but too bad it doesn't work. I am very tech savvy and I pity those who are not technical. I would NOT purchase this product (this is my first negative review of any product.)
customer_reviews.author: Bob Haydock

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to troubleshoot, prone to issues
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it works fine. But when it doesn’t, it’s a headache to troubleshoot The included app is buggy and laggy, which makes setup and troubleshooting frustrating. Would not recommend this product or Wemo branded products to friends and family, considering I’m the family IT guy. Sometimes Alexa says it can’t communicate with the Wemo. This is difficult to diagnose. The Wemo Mini is not compatible with my wifi access point’s (TP-Link EAP225 v3) airtime fairness feature. I had to disable it so that the Mini would finish the setup process
customer_reviews.author: M.T.

customer_reviews.title: Other Wemo switches all work great, this one does not work at all
customer_reviews.text: I've got 2 Wemo Insight switches and 2 Wemo Smart Switches, which work well and never drop from wifi. They're all tied to my Alexa. I picked up a Mini recently and it does not hold a connection and is constantly unavailable for Alexa/in the Wemo app. I've reset it, reset my own internet, both, regrouped, renamed, etc - everything, and the other Wemo switches work but the Mini simply does not. I'll likely return this and pick up a regular insight instead, since it seems more reliable
customer_reviews.author: KevinEff

customer_reviews.title: Very buggy and unreliable
customer_reviews.text: This is the buggiest product I've seen in many years. I spent an hour on the phone with Belkin trying to get it to work. When I finally got it working, I set up a rule to turn itself off a few minutes after it was turned on. This only works maybe 2 out of 3 times, very unreliable. I ended up using a Meross WiFi Smart Plug Mini. This only took a few minutes to set up and having it turn itself off after a few minutes has been very reliable. It's also far cheaper. I'm very surprised Belkin would sell a product this bad.
customer_reviews.author: Paul J

customer_reviews.title: Installation can be hit or miss
customer_reviews.text: When they work, they seem to work well. But I've occasionally run into devices that won't properly set up. I suspect the majority of the problems are in the mobile software (Android and IOS with IOS being much worse). My guess is the jumping back and forth across wifi networks gets the phone and the device out of sync and it is hard to troubleshoot and figure out what is wrong. I'll probably continue to buy them for myself, when they make sense, but I hate trying to deal with them at friends and families homes. I've wasted hours with these products.
customer_reviews.author: James B Rush

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t play well (or at all) with Alexa.
customer_reviews.text: Followed all setup directions multiple times but the Alexa app does not “find” the device, so this is worthless to me. Sending it back. Note, if you are considering purchasing this you should first read all the most recent comments posted in the Apple Store under the Wemo app. There seems to be a mass connecivity issue.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthy

customer_reviews.title: HomeKit Air Conditioner AC control
customer_reviews.text: HomeKit: this is my first "software" HomeKit device. Not as easy to setup as hardware type HomeKit devices. Required a reboot of my iOS device to connect to HomeKit. But then it finally worked. Quite a shame it doesn't do energy usage monitoring, because it would be another star if it did. But WEMO wants you to buy a whole separate device for that. I'm using it with a window AC air conditioner and it seems solid like that.
customer_reviews.author: EttanASF

customer_reviews.title: Wemos are now INCOMPATIBLE with mesh WiFi networks like Orbi, Eero, etc
customer_reviews.text: Wemo plugs setup process is INCOMPATIBLE with mesh networks like Orbi, Eero, etc. (google it to see all the agony). (Net: it requires your phone to be connected to 2.4 gHz, not 5 gHz. I can’t force that with my Orbi. After 2 hrs wasted time, I am going to return the 4 I just purchased from Cost co. Can anyone recommend an alternative?
customer_reviews.author: Picky Picky

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS PRODUCT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this product gets good to every good reviews. That is correct UNLESS YOU REPLACE YOUR MODEM or YOU MAKE ANY CHANGES TO YOUR WIFI SYSTEM. It requires that you reinstall PAINFULLY RE-INSTALL EVERY SINGLE MODULE one by one. IF YOU HAVE AN IPHONE IT IS NEXT TO IMPOSSIBLE. I tried customer service and got nowhere. I tried every trick in the book. Reboot, clear the cache, reset the model, on/off all devices, you name it. I got escalated up one level but nothing helps this process. They know the problem exists but give the caller the double take. Save yourself the headache. Too bad
customer_reviews.author: Pete C

customer_reviews.title: Least reliable smart device I’ve ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Not reliable at all. Requires constant factory reset and repeated set-up. My magic home plugs and other smart devices work flawlessly, while this wemo plug requires constant attention. There are much better brands out there. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Hingle

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and Effective
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had 3 different kinds of smart plugs including this Wemo brand. The Wemo mini plugs are the easiest to install, use, and integrate. They also look the best. You can install two in one socket fixture because they’re so small. Or you can install one, and have enough room to use the other socket. When the other plugs (located in the same room and at the same distance from the router) have lost signal continuously, Wemo hasn’t. I bought these as gifts for all the smart-home people in my life because they’re affordable and effective.
customer_reviews.author: Krysta

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I love these things! Or use them for Halloween light up decorations, Christmas lights, lambs in my home, anything that plugs in that I want to come on and off automatically. I set up timers and they do exactly as they should! Set up was incredibly easy as well. But I’m pretty text savvy so I can’t speak for those who aren’t. However I would think it would be pretty easy for most as there’s only three steps to getting them going. You will want to download the app to go with them! And it is free.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect, the setup is a pain.
customer_reviews.text: These changed my life! I didn't know I needed these until I used them. I can now control lights across my apartment from my apple devices. They work perfectly all the time. Only problem was the initial setup with the wemo app and integrating these devices into Apple home app. the process is glitchy and took multiple tries to get multiple devices into Apple Home app. But once I got that done, they work like a charm. I am happy with my purchase. Update 1/4/2020: Working perfectly with Apple HomeKit no issues. Moving them around the house they automatically connect and show up under my Home app on iPhone. Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Vish B

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 of these. They were fairly easy to set up if you have some technical ability / understanding. Once set up they did function as promised for about 1 - 2 weeks. After that each of the switches loses connectivity and all need reset again. Once reset they work another few hours to 2 days. My wifi / router setup is fine with no other problems. Alexa ends up with "Belkin Wemo not responding" and Wemo app shows not connected. Bunch of garbage for the time and money spent. DON'T BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Graywolf

customer_reviews.title: App is horrible. Avoid if you can
customer_reviews.text: So I've had wemo switches and plugs from the first go round. Was mostly happy with em. Then I buy this new switch and I now need an account to even add them to my app.... So I abide and then of course the activation program on the app sucks. It basically hangs after you select the plug and does nothing. I solved this by manually connecting wifi to the plug which they do not walk you through at all.
customer_reviews.author: Disciprine

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy these unless you can be there, physically, ALL of the time.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use these on our summer home, 3000 miles away. But it doesn't work...if I am not connected to my wifi at the physical location, I can't control ANY of the Wemo devices. And if the power goes out, you must be physically there to reset the device. This does me NO good for a second home. Also, you can only have one "home", so I can't use Wemo devices in two different homes (yes, there are kluggy work-arounds, but I shouldn't have to do that). So now I have 4 plugs, a dimmer switch and a 3-way switch that are totally useless to me. What a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Oregon Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: Works with HomeKit, but you have to troubleshoot on your own
customer_reviews.text: Once it is setup, the Wemo outlets have worked perfectly with HomeKit. Getting them set up is a nightmare. The support page and instructions are basically useless. Here is what you need to know: You can only connect to a 2.4GHz connection. My router has 2.4GHz and 5.0GHz. You must be connected to the 2.4GHz connection to setup a wemo outlet. Then, once you connect one wemo outlet, you must then tell you phone to connect to the 2.4GHz network again, otherwise it will stay connected to the wemo you just setup and the next one won’t work. Nothing in the support Marietta tells you that these are the main reasons they fail during setup.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I had a very frustrating time trying to set this up to work with Homekit. Was ready to send it back when I decided to call WeMo help. They answered within 1 minute (unheard of today). The young lady talked me through the difficult (for me) process of updating the firmware to allow it to work with Homekit. After about 15 minutes of very patient step by step conversation the update was complete and all was well with Homekit. I would certainly purchase another after this incredible customer service experience.
customer_reviews.author: Carl H

customer_reviews.title: Constant connection issues - difficult to reconnect
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 wifi points in my house, one by Google WiFi and the other by Arris. It connects to Arris only and it's close to impossible to connect to Google assistant. You have to make several attempts and you have to actually type wifi name and Mac address and you have to get it right the first time or you get locked out for 10 min (so frustrating). I own about 15 smart switches and other smart devices and I have never encountered one that is so poorly designed and so user unfriendly. If I could, I would return in a heartbeat. There are so many better options out there. I do not recommend this switch to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Lukasz

customer_reviews.title: Alexa Friendly - Apple Home Kit FAILURE
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I bought mine some time ago and they were Gen 1 Smartplugs but, they became dumb and would simply not work. The reason, no code to scan and none to enter after being in a support call with an amazingly wonderful (seriously they have great support people) over 3 calls and 4 hours. I do not recommend this plug. Had the company made the effort as I requested, to exchange them for working units, I'd have a positive review.
customer_reviews.author: John E. Litton

customer_reviews.title: Great product for your smart home!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased a 3-pack of the Wemo Mini Smart Plugs. Initial setup was easy enough, but took longer than expected. I recommend updating the firmware first thing allowing for remote access (access outside of your wifi network). The plugs look great. They are wider than I'd prefer, however can be stacked two to an outlet which is a great design. I have them set up with string lighting and lamps. These plugs work as good or better than I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Good when working, but had repeat issue
customer_reviews.text: We've had this plug for three years, but finally had to give up on it. Randomly it would lose connectivity to the app and our google home. Sometimes it would be an issue with a firmware update and sometimes we'd have to delete it entirely and re-link it to our account. This month it finally completely gave up the ghost. Despite deleting and re-installing and searching for firmware updates, it would not sync anymore. We couldn't control it either from the app or from our google home. We have other plugs from a different maker that have never gave us trouble, so we just purchased another one of those and chucked this one in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: T. R. Wade

customer_reviews.title: Great device with a couple of minor quibbles
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with the plug aside from two issues: 1. It doesn't run on 5GHz networks. 2. Wifi authentication doesn't support captive portals. The first is no big deal; most people have dual-band routers. The second is a bit more annoying. I can't use this at work, for example, without getting IT to do a bunch of work. Additionally, setup was a bit tricky since it didn't immediately recognize my wifi but it did eventually get there. Not a big deal at all. Integration with IFTTT is great, and I like that I can use third-party tools like ouimeaux to work with this. Very recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Carl Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Smart plugs not so smart
customer_reviews.text: These are the dumbest smart plugs ever! They only work 2 or 3 times, then i have to unplug and re-plug them in, because they lose their connection to the internet. It was easier, to just turn the things on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a Letdown :(
customer_reviews.text: Really makes you think you’re on the right track of connecting and getting it to work but.. it’s just a cycle of failure, again and again and again. What a let down. I am very tech savvy and actually enjoy troubleshooting but this lil bugger never worked. The devices all see each other but the app can never finish the adding process. Pass on this, try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So easy and convenient
customer_reviews.text: This is a really cool gadget. It was my first try at smart lighting and it couldn't be easier. You download the app follow the instructions and the next thing you know, your light is being turned on and off remotely as if you were there. We went out one day not realizing that it was getting dark and we didn't leave any lights on. I just opened the app on my phone and turned on the light while we were out and about. It was nice to come home to a house that had a light on. With the app you can add more wemo devices in other rooms and control them individually, however you choose. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MsPilates

customer_reviews.title: Works well throughout my home.
customer_reviews.text: So far I have 4 of the mini smart plugs. Don't understand the negative ratings other than people not understanding how to set up to WiFi. Once you have installed the app on your phone, additional plugs are simple to add. Works with all my Alexa devices. Intend to buy more. **UPDATE** Using 2 months now. No issues. Even had a couple power failures and they all came back on line without assistance. They work great!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Mine did not resume the on state after power failure
customer_reviews.text: During the summer thunderstorms I came home at night and lamps were not on. It was because a power failure occurred after sunset. These do not appear to resume the on state and wait until the next evening. This is unacceptable and I like the Wemo brand idea. But they really should fix this issue. They have not as far as I know. So be aware your house or devices will remain off after power failures occur during their scheduled on time! Otherwise no problems during the Autumn.
customer_reviews.author: virtuosic

customer_reviews.title: HomeKit on an iPad was not so good
customer_reviews.text: I’ll go 4 stars but not sure if this is WEMO’s issue or Apple’s. Got 3 plugs. I upgraded the plug’s firmware, and then enabled HomeKit (iPad as hub). The HomeKit app is nice, and all looked good. But after my iPad was asleep and I woke it, the app did not reconnect to the plugs without multiple retries (3-4). Not workable. Not sure if it would work better with Apple TV or a HomePod, but I’m not ready to try that. Instead I switched to the Wemo app which seems to work quite well. Note - 1500 sq ft single story house with router centrally located.
customer_reviews.author: mountainhouse
